@gingeripod @theirishfor It was young Irish speakers who taught me "fÃ³n pÃ³ca" - their enthusiasm was catching. Like my French teachers, unlike the stern bad-tempered ones we had for Irish.
@gingeripod @CamilleLoftus @theirishfor What astonished me was learning decades later that school edition of Peig was censored.

@CamilleLoftus @gingeripod @theirishfor I don't know. I loved French, but I think it was easier because we already expected inflection, changes to adjectives, plurals like "ye" that no longer exist in English.
@beansi50 @theirishfor IDK if it helps you, but I use the SwiftKey app. It's free, and a long press on any letter brings it up with a fada.
